item.description:
The cuisine of each South American country has its own unique take on several common denominators. Venezuela, for example, has embraced and expanded on the Spanish tradition of Tapas, and developed its own version of the ubiquitous corn bread that's

more cake than bread. La Casa de Pedro is a relatively new restaurant whose chef-owner is a Venezuelan native on a mission to introduce local diners to the flavors of his homeland. Sounds like a good idea to me, especially now that the restaurant's patio is open for outdoor dining! To add even more South American flavor, there is music on Friday nights.

NOTE: The restaurant claims to be strict about having a 2-hour-limit per table. Let's hope their service is fast enough to enable us to eat at a comfortable pace, or I will do battle with them on everyone's behalf. In aid of this, PLEASE be on time so we can be seated promptly and fully enjoy our allotted time!
item.how_to_find_us: Meet in front of the restaurant. They won't seat us unless we are all together when we go in.
item.name: Friday Al Fresco Dinner, Venezuelan-Style
